WorkItem.Description:
While trying out various arcane specs and gear setups, I noticed Shifting Naaru Sliver is better dps for certain builds than the Forge Ember I was using for fire. So I equipped it and Rawr suddenly bloated to huge memory size slowly bringing my laptop to a standstill. I'm thinking that with all various combinations of arcane rotations that adding another activated cooldown is just offering Rawr far too many possibilities.
Â 
For the record, I have a limit of 100 iterations, 'depth first' selected, 'segmented cooldowns' and 'integral mana consumables' set for display but not for comparison.

Comments.Message: This sounds like a bug, care to attach the xml?

I would have, only I had to force end process on Rawr to stop it, and as such don't have a save to repro the problem. I'll try this afternoon again to see if I can get close to the problem and give you a save where you just have to swap in a clicky-tricket to trigger it.

Actually I'm starting to believe now that it's because I had too much other stuff running (Virtual PC, SQL Server and manager, etc). Rawr was probably only able to allocate 800-900 megs freely and the slowdown probably happened when it went above that and windows started trying to reallocate memory from the other apps.

You can close this ticket, I'll make a new if I see something more concrete.
